Class FractalGenerator

  • Object
    • FractalGenerator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BurningShip, Mandelbrot, Tricorn

    public abstract class FractalGenerator
extends Object
    This class provides the common interface and operations for fractal generators that can be viewed in the Fractal Explorer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FractalGenerator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double getCoord(double rangeMin, double rangeMax, int size, int coord)
      This static helper function takes an integer coordinate and converts it into a double-precision value corresponding to a specific range.
      abstract void getInitialRange(Rectangle2D.Double range)
      Sets the specified rectangle to contain the initial range suitable for the fractal being generated.
      abstract int numIterations(double x, double y)
      Given a coordinate x + iy in the complex plane, computes and returns the number of iterations before the fractal function escapes the bounding area for that point.
      void recenterAndZoomRange(Rectangle2D.Double range, double centerX, double centerY, double scale)
      Updates the current range to be centered at the specified coordinates, and to be zoomed in or out by the specified scaling factor.

      • FractalGenerator

        public FractalGenerator()

    • Method Detail

      • getCoord

        public static double getCoord(double rangeMin,
                              double rangeMax,
                              int size,
                              int coord)
        This static helper function takes an integer coordinate and converts it into a double-precision value corresponding to a specific range. It is used to convert pixel coordinates into double-precision values for computing fractals, etc.
        Parameters:
        rangeMin - the minimum value of the floating-point range
        rangeMax - the maximum value of the floating-point range
        size - the size of the dimension that the pixel coordinate is from. For example, this might be the image width, or the image height.
        coord - the coordinate to compute the double-precision value for. The coordinate should fall in the range [0, size].

      • getInitialRange

        public abstract void getInitialRange(Rectangle2D.Double range)
        Sets the specified rectangle to contain the initial range suitable for the fractal being generated.

      • recenterAndZoomRange

        public void recenterAndZoomRange(Rectangle2D.Double range,
                                 double centerX,
                                 double centerY,
                                 double scale)
        Updates the current range to be centered at the specified coordinates, and to be zoomed in or out by the specified scaling factor.

      • numIterations

        public abstract int numIterations(double x,
                                  double y)
        Given a coordinate x + iy in the complex plane, computes and returns the number of iterations before the fractal function escapes the bounding area for that point. A point that doesn't escape before the iteration limit is reached is indicated with a result of -1.
